Property.name: sar_file
Property.Description: Absolute path to a specified SAR file or to all SAR files included in the ZIP file

Property.name: config_plan
Property.Description: Absolute path of a configuration plan to be applied to a specified SAR file or to all SAR files included in the ZIP file

Property.name: label
Property.Description: Label of the SOA composite application

Property.name: sar_revision
Property.Description: Revision of SOA composite application

Property.name: connect_to_server
Property.Description: Defines if WLST should connect to a server with the given Host, Port, Username, Password before executing the script. YES/NO

Property.name: script_path
Property.Description: Path to the Python script which will be executed with WLST. Path can be absolute or relative to WL_HOME.

Property.name: package
Property.Description: Path of the application directory, archive file, or root of the exploded archive directory to be deployed

Property.name: revision
Property.Description: Application Revision

Property.name: options
Property.Description: Optional. Comma-separated list of deployment options, specified as name-value pairs

Property.name: jms_server
Property.Description: JMS server name

Property.name: jms_module
Property.Description: JMS module name

Property.name: jms_subdeployment
Property.Description: JMS subdeployment name

Property.name: jms_resource_name
Property.Description: JMS resource name (for message queues and topics)

Property.name: submodule_targets
Property.Description: JMS resource JNDI name

Property.name: jdbc_name
Property.Description: Name of the JDBC

Property.name: jndi_name
Property.Description: Name of the JNDI

Property.name: jdbc_driver
Property.Description: Driver / Java class name used for the connection eg: oracle.jdbc.xa.client.OracleXADataSource

Property.name: jdbc_url
Property.Description: Datasource connection url eg: jdbc:oracle:thin:@server:port:sid or jdbc:weblogic:sqlserver://server:port

Property.name: jdbc_username
Property.Description: Username used to authenticate with the datasource

Property.name: jdbc_password
Property.Description: Password used to authenticate with the datasource

Property.name: jdbc_database
Property.Description: Name of the database

Property.name: jdbc_driver_properties
Property.Description: Additional driver properties eg: portNumber=1433,databaseName=mydb,serverName=myserver

Property.name: jdbc_test_table
Property.Description: Test table name or test query used to test database connections. Eg 'SQL SELECT 1 FROM DUAL'

Property.name: persistentstore_name
Property.Description: Name of the persistent store

Property.name: target_server
Property.Description: The server instances, clusters, or migratable targets defined in the current domain that are candidates for hosting a file store, JDBC store, or replicated store

Property.name: filestore_dir
Property.Description: Path to the directory in which the filestore will be stored

Property.name: filestore_params
Property.Description: Additional parameters that can be specified for firestore

Property.name: jdbcstore_prefix
Property.Description: Prefix for the tables that are stored within the datasource

Property.name: jdbcstore_params
Property.Description: Additional parameters that can be specified for jdbcstore

Property.name: multicast_address
Property.Description: IP address dedicate to multicast communications for cluster (IP address between 224.0.0.0 and 239.255.255.255)

Property.name: multicast_port
Property.Description: Port dedicate to multicast communications for cluster

Property.name: frontend_host
Property.Description: Name of the host that represents the cluster (endpoint for WSDL generation)

Property.name: frontend_http_port
Property.Description: HTTP Port that represents the cluster (endpoint for WSDL generation)

Property.name: frontend_https_port
Property.Description: HTTPS Port that represents the cluster (endpoint for WSDL generation)

Property.name: cluster_properties
Property.Description: Addtional parameters that can be specified for cluster

Property.name: machine_properties
Property.Description: Addtional parameters that can be specified for machine

Property.name: domain_properties
Property.Description: Addtional parameters that can be specified for domain

Property.name: /snapshot/archive_path
Property.Description: The path where all snapshots will be stored.

Property.name: /snapshot/source_path
Property.Description: The path to the directory, that the snapshot will be taken of.

Property.name: /snapshot/snapshot_filter_include
Property.Description: Filter the snapshot by filename. Multiple filters can be given using , as seperator. Eg: dir1/*,*.txt

Property.name: /snapshot/snapshot_filter_exclude
Property.Description: Filter the snapshot by filename. Multiple filters can be given using , as seperator. Eg: dir1/*,*.txt

Property.name: /oracle_soa/application_name
Property.Description: Name of the application which will be used for install and uninstall actions among others

Property.name: /oracle_soa/revision
Property.Description: Revision of SOA composite application

Property.name: /oracle_soa/label
Property.Description: Label of the SOA composite application

Property.name: /oracle_soa/sar_location
Property.Description: Absolute path to a specified SAR file or to all SAR files included in the ZIP file.

Property.name: /oracle_soa/config_plan
Property.Description: Absolute path of a configuration plan to be applied to a specified SAR file or to all SAR files included in the ZIP file.

Property.name: /oracle_soa/oracle_home
Property.Description: Oracle Home directory

Property.name: /oracle_soa/server
Property.Description: Name of the WebLogic server(s)

Property.name: /oracle_soa/cluster
Property.Description: Name of the WebLogic cluster(s)

Property.name: /oracle_soa/machine
Property.Description: Name(s) of the machine(s) the WebLogic server(s) are located on

Property.name: /oracle_soa/targets
Property.Description: Deployment targets equals target servers and clusters

Property.name: /oracle_soa/submodule_targets
Property.Description: Submodule level targets for JMS modules. For example,submod@mod-jms.xml@target or submoduleName@target

Property.name: /oracle_soa/package
Property.Description: Path of the application directory, archive file, or root of the exploded archive directory to be deployed

Property.name: /oracle_soa/options
Property.Description: Optional. Comma-separated list of deployment options, specified as name-value pairs

Property.name: /oracle_soa/script/connect_to_server
Property.Description: Defines if WLST should connect to a server with the given Host, Port, Username, Password before executing the script. YES/NO

Property.name: /oracle_soa/script/script_path
Property.Description: Path to the Python script which will be executed with WLST. Path can be absolute or relative to WL_HOME.

Property.name: /oracle_soa/jms/server
Property.Description: JMS server name

Property.name: /oracle_soa/jms/module
Property.Description: JMS module name

Property.name: /oracle_soa/jms/subdeployment
Property.Description: JMS subdeployment name

Property.name: /oracle_soa/jms/resource_name
Property.Description: JMS resource name (for message queues and topics)

Property.name: /oracle_soa/jms/resource_jndi_name
Property.Description: JMS resource JNDI name

Property.name: /oracle_soa/jdbc/driver
Property.Description: Driver / Java class name used for the connection eg: oracle.jdbc.xa.client.OracleXADataSource

Property.name: /oracle_soa/jdbc/name
Property.Description: Name of the datasource

Property.name: /oracle_soa/jdbc/jndi_name
Property.Description: JNDI name of the datasource

Property.name: /oracle_soa/jdbc/url
Property.Description: Datasource connection url eg: jdbc:oracle:thin:@server:port:sid or jdbc:weblogic:sqlserver://server:port

Property.name: /oracle_soa/jdbc/username
Property.Description: Username used to authenticate with the datasource

Property.name: /oracle_soa/jdbc/password
Property.Description: Password used to authenticate with the datasource

Property.name: /oracle_soa/jdbc/database
Property.Description: Name of the database

Property.name: /oracle_soa/jdbc/driver_properties
Property.Description: Additional driver properties eg: portNumber=1433,databaseName=mydb,serverName=myserver

Property.name: /oracle_soa/jdbc/test_table
Property.Description: Test table name or test query used to test database connections. Eg 'SQL SELECT 1 FROM DUAL'

Property.name: /oracle_soa/persistentstore/name
Property.Description: Name of the persistent store

Property.name: /oracle_soa/persistentstore/target_server
Property.Description: The server instances, clusters, or migratable targets defined in the current domain that are candidates for hosting a file store, JDBC store, or replicated store

Property.name: /oracle_soa/persistentstore/filestore/directory
Property.Description: Path to the directory in which the filestore will be stored

Property.name: /oracle_soa/persistentstore/filestore/params
Property.Description: Additional parameters that can be specified for firestore

Property.name: /oracle_soa/persistentstore/jdbcstore/prefix
Property.Description: Prefix for the tables that are stored within the datasource

Property.name: /oracle_soa/persistentstore/jdbcstore/params
Property.Description: Additional parameters that can be specified for jdbcstore

Property.name: /oracle_soa/server/host
Property.Description: Hostname or IP address of the physical machine

Property.name: /oracle_soa/server/port
Property.Description: Port number which should be used to connect

Property.name: /oracle_soa/server/protocol
Property.Description: Connection protocol to connect WLST to server

Property.name: /oracle_soa/server/username
Property.Description: Username used to authenticate with WebLogic

Property.name: /oracle_soa/server/password
Property.Description: Password used to authenticate with WebLogic

Property.name: /oracle_soa/server/url
Property.Description: URL of the Administration Server

Property.name: /oracle_soa/server/start_script
Property.Description: Script to use to start up the Domain Administration Server

Property.name: /oracle_soa/server/shutdown_script
Property.Description: Script to use to shutdown the Domain Administration Server

Property.name: /oracle_soa/server/service
Property.Description: Windows Service name of Administration Server

Property.name: /oracle_soa/cluster/multicast_address
Property.Description: IP address dedicate to multicast communications for cluster (IP address between 224.0.0.0 and 239.255.255.255)

Property.name: /oracle_soa/cluster/multicast_port
Property.Description: Port dedicate to multicast communications for cluster

Property.name: /oracle_soa/cluster/frontend_host
Property.Description: Name of the host that represents the cluster (endpoint for WSDL generation)

Property.name: /oracle_soa/cluster/frontend_http_port
Property.Description: HTTP Port that represents the cluster (endpoint for WSDL generation)

Property.name: /oracle_soa/cluster/frontend_https_port
Property.Description: HTTPS Port that represents the cluster (endpoint for WSDL generation)

Property.name: /oracle_soa/cluster/cluster_properties
Property.Description: Addtional parameters that can be specified for cluster

Property.name: /oracle_soa/machine/machine_properties
Property.Description: Addtional parameters that can be specified for machine

Property.name: /oracle_soa/machine/nm_host
Property.Description: IP or hostname of the Node Manager

Property.name: /oracle_soa/machine/nm_port
Property.Description: Port number used to connect to the Node Manager

Property.name: /oracle_soa/machine/nm_username
Property.Description: Username of the operator who is connecting WLST to Node Manager

Property.name: /oracle_soa/machine/nm_password
Property.Description: Password of the operator who is connecting WLST to Node Manager

Property.name: /oracle_soa/machine/nm_type
Property.Description: The Node Manager type user want to connect to

Property.name: /oracle_soa/machine/start_script
Property.Description: Script to use to start up the Node Manager

Property.name: /oracle_soa/machine/shutdown_script
Property.Description: Script to use to shutdownn the Node Manager

Property.name: /oracle_soa/machine/service
Property.Description: Windows Service name of the node manager

Property.name: /oracle_soa/domain/domain_dir
Property.Description: Path of the domain directory to which user want to save the Node Manager secret file (nm_password.properties) and SerializedSystemIni.dat file. This argument defaults to the directory in which WLST was started

Property.name: /oracle_soa/domain/domain_name
Property.Description: Name of the WebLogic domain that user want to manage

Property.name: /oracle_soa/domain/domain_properties
Property.Description: Addtional parameters that can be specified for domain

Property.name: /source/protocol
Property.Description: Defines the protocol to use to get the component from source.

Property.name: /source/source_files_dirs
Property.Description: Remote file/directory to be downloaded. Directory not supported for HTTP(S). Not required for TFS, CVS, SVN

Property.name: /target/target_files_dirs
Property.Description: Name of a local file/directory where downloaded file/directory is stored. HTTP(S):Directory not supported. CVS, TFS: must be a directory.

Property.name: /target/overwrite_target
Property.Description: Overwrite local files/directory if exist. For SVN, all files will be exported but already present files will not be overwritten. For TFS, overwrites all items in the workspace(CLI: /force)

Property.name: /source/http/url
Property.Description: URL

Property.name: /source/http/port
Property.Description: Port of HTTP connection

Property.name: /source/http/username
Property.Description: Username to authenticate with the server (if required by the server)

Property.name: /source/http/password
Property.Description: Password to authenticate with the server (if required by the server)

Property.name: /source/http/connection_timeout
Property.Description: Timeout in miliseconds to wait to build up a connection to the target host. Default: 5000.

Property.name: /source/http/proxy_host
Property.Description: Proxy host to use.

Property.name: /source/http/proxy_port
Property.Description: Proxy port to use.

Property.name: /source/http/proxy_user
Property.Description: Username if proxy requires authentication.

Property.name: /source/http/proxy_pwd
Property.Description: Password if proxy requires authentication.

Property.name: /source/https/url
Property.Description: URL

Property.name: /source/https/port
Property.Description: Port of HTTPS connection

Property.name: /source/https/username
Property.Description: Username to authenticate with the server (if required by the server)

Property.name: /source/https/password
Property.Description: Password to authenticate with the server (if required by the server)

Property.name: /source/https/connection_timeout
Property.Description: Timeout in miliseconds to wait to build up a connection to the target host. Default: 5000.

Property.name: /source/https/proxy_host
Property.Description: Proxy host to use.

Property.name: /source/https/proxy_port
Property.Description: Proxy port to use.

Property.name: /source/https/proxy_user
Property.Description: Username if proxy requires authentication.

Property.name: /source/https/proxy_pwd
Property.Description: Password if proxy requires authentication.

Property.name: /source/ftp/host
Property.Description: Host to connect to.

Property.name: /source/ftp/port
Property.Description: Port to connect to.

Property.name: /source/ftp/username
Property.Description: Username to authenticate with the server (if required by the server)

Property.name: /source/ftp/password
Property.Description: Password to authenticate with the server (if required by the server)

Property.name: /source/ftp/recursive_download
Property.Description: Recursively get files and directories. If set to no, only direct children of the directory are downloaded

Property.name: /source/ftp/connection_timeout
Property.Description: Timeout in miliseconds to wait to build up a connection to the target host. Default: 5000.

Property.name: /source/ftp/proxy_host
Property.Description: Proxy host to use.

Property.name: /source/ftp/proxy_port
Property.Description: Proxy port to use.

Property.name: /source/ftp/proxy_user
Property.Description: Username if proxy requires authentication.

Property.name: /source/ftp/proxy_pwd
Property.Description: Password if proxy requires authentication.

Property.name: /source/ftp/transfer_mode
Property.Description: Text/Binary transfer modes.

Property.name: /source/ftps/host
Property.Description: Host to connect to.

Property.name: /source/ftps/port
Property.Description: Port to connect to.

Property.name: /source/ftps/username
Property.Description: Username to authenticate with the server (if required by the server)

Property.name: /source/ftps/password
Property.Description: Password to authenticate with the server (if required by the server)

Property.name: /source/ftps/recursive_download
Property.Description: Recursively get files and directories. If set to no, only direct children of the directory are downloaded

Property.name: /source/ftps/connection_timeout
Property.Description: Timeout in miliseconds to wait to build up a connection to the target host. Default: 5000.

Property.name: /source/ftps/proxy_host
Property.Description: Proxy host to use.

Property.name: /source/ftps/proxy_port
Property.Description: Proxy port to use.

Property.name: /source/ftps/proxy_user
Property.Description: Username if proxy requires authentication.

Property.name: /source/ftps/proxy_pwd
Property.Description: Password if proxy requires authentication.

Property.name: /source/ftps/transfer_mode
Property.Description: Text/Binary transfer modes.

Property.name: /source/sftp/host
Property.Description: Host to connect to.

Property.name: /source/sftp/port
Property.Description: Port to connect to.

Property.name: /source/sftp/username
Property.Description: Username to authenticate with the server (if required by the server)

Property.name: /source/sftp/password
Property.Description: Password to authenticate with the server (if required by the server)

Property.name: /source/sftp/recursive_download
Property.Description: Recursively get files and directories. If set to no, only direct children of the directory are downloaded

Property.name: /source/sftp/connection_timeout
Property.Description: Timeout in miliseconds to wait to build up a connection to the target host. Default: 5000.

Property.name: /source/sftp/preserve_att
Property.Description: Preserves creation/modification times and modes of the original files. Default: yes

Property.name: /source/scp/host
Property.Description: Host to connect to.

Property.name: /source/scp/port
Property.Description: Port to connect to.

Property.name: /source/scp/username
Property.Description: Username to authenticate with the server (if required by the server)

Property.name: /source/scp/password
Property.Description: Password to authenticate with the server (if required by the server)

Property.name: /source/scp/preserve_att
Property.Description: Preserves creation/modification times and modes of the original files. Default: yes

Property.name: /source/scp/recursive_download
Property.Description: Recursively get files and directories. If set to no, only direct children of the directory are downloaded

Property.name: /source/scp/connection_timeout
Property.Description: Timeout in miliseconds to wait to build up a connection to the target host. Default: 5000.

Property.name: /source/smb/host
Property.Description: Host to connect to.

Property.name: /source/smb/port
Property.Description: Port to connect to.

Property.name: /source/smb/username
Property.Description: Username to authenticate with the server (if required by the server)

Property.name: /source/smb/password
Property.Description: Password to authenticate with the server (if required by the server)

Property.name: /source/smb/preserve_att
Property.Description: Preserves creation/modification times and modes of the original files. Default: yes

Property.name: /source/smb/recursive_download
Property.Description: Recursively get files and directories. If set to no, only direct children of the directory are downloaded

Property.name: /source/smb/connection_timeout
Property.Description: Timeout in miliseconds to wait to build up a connection to the target host. Default: 5000.

Property.name: /source/smb/domain_name
Property.Description: Required if target machine belongs to a windows domain.

Property.name: /source/uc4_ft/host
Property.Description: The source host (agent name).

Property.name: /source/uc4_ft/transfer_format
Property.Description: Transfer format setting. Default: text

Property.name: /source/uc4_ft/use_compression
Property.Description: Use the compression for the transfer (needs CPU!). Default: no

Property.name: /source/uc4_ft/transfer_subdirs
Property.Description: Option to transfer the content of the sub directories as well(works only if source file is a directory). Default: yes

Property.name: /source/uc4_ft/parallel_transfer
Property.Description: Number of parallel transfers (works only if source file is a directory). Default: 5

Property.name: /source/svn/uri
Property.Description: Repository URI. Example: svn://repo/app/trunk or https://repo:1942/app/trunk.

Property.name: /source/svn/username
Property.Description: Username used for authentication with the repository.

Property.name: /source/svn/password
Property.Description: Password used for authentication with the repository.

Property.name: /source/svn/revision
Property.Description: Revision number. In case no revision is specified, revision will be HEAD. CLI option -r.

Property.name: /source/svn/trust_server_cert
Property.Description: Defines whether to accept unknown SSL server certificates or not. CLI option --trust-server-cert. Default: Yes

Property.name: /source/cvs/uri
Property.Description: Repository URI. Example: ":pserver:username@cvs.server.local:/usr/local/cvs/application".

Property.name: /source/cvs/module
Property.Description: Module that should be exported.

Property.name: /source/cvs/password
Property.Description: Password used for authentication with the repository.

Property.name: /source/cvs/revision
Property.Description: Revision number. In case no revision is specified, revision will be HEAD. CLI option -r.

Property.name: /source/tfs/util_path
Property.Description: Path to the tf.exe utility which will be used to communicate with Team Foundation Server. If no path was specified, the default value (C:/Program Files/Microsoft Visual Studio 9.0/Common7/IDE/Tf) will be assumed.

Property.name: /source/tfs/item
Property.Description: File or folder to retrieve. If no itemspec is provided, Team Foundation Server performs a recursive get operation of the current workspace. For ex: $/Project/

Property.name: /source/tfs/version
Property.Description: Optional version specification. The versionspec is the version of the item you want to retrieve. You can specify a version by: Date/time (D10/20/2005), Changeset version (C1256), Label (Lmylabel), Latest version (T), Workspace version (Workspacename;owner). If no version is provided, Team Foundation Server retrieves the latest server version of the specified itemspec into your workspace.

Property.name: /source/tfs/retrieve_all
Property.Description: Replace the file on disk, even if the workspace version is the same as the requested server version. Used when "Overwrite files" option is set to NO.(CLI option /all)

Property.name: /source/tfs/overwrite
Property.Description: Forcibly overwrite the writable current workspace version with a specified server version. Used only when "Overwrite files" option is set to NO.(CLI option /overwrite)

Property.name: /source/tfs/recursive
Property.Description: Recursively retrieves all items that match your itemspec.

Property.name: /staging/working_files_dirs
Property.Description: Files/Directory on the staging server after downloaded from source.

Property.name: /staging/agent
Property.Description: Agent which will be used for staging

Property.name: /staging/working_base_dir
Property.Description: Base directory on the staging server where package should be downloaded to.
